Our hearts â¤ï¸

"I am humbled and incredibly grateful to Chris Clark and Jarmo (Kekalainen) and the front office for putting their faith in me. They do a great job of developing not only players but coaches and people and staff as well." - Vogelhuber

>https://t.co/xEq0qtdp7y< https://t.co/2Vh6vrWblW

He found himself behind the Monsters' bench in 2018-19 as an assistant before being named head coach on June 8, 2022. 

>https://t.co/xEq0qtdp7y< https://t.co/ARNJ48Y2uE

After signing with the #CBJ, he spent four seasons with their AHL team in Springfield and one when it moved to CLE.

During the Calder Cup season of 2015-16 he posted 11G/27P in the reg. season and played in all 17 playoff games. 

>https://t.co/xEq0qtdp7y< https://t.co/gXsnp5VQRm

Vogelhuber's journey to the pros began with the @AAABlueJackets before playing four seasons with @MiamiOH_Hockey. 

He was chosen in the seventh round of the 2007 draft by the #CBJ. 

>https://t.co/xEq0qtdp7y< https://t.co/Ad5H4B0fPK
